result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela A Gallegos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable but waived. DNA surcharge is waived as no DNA sample was taken.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Complete a parenting class.
- Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Violent Contact with her children.
- No physical discipline.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order.
- Maintain a safe, clean home; to be periodically checked by the agent.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment or attend school.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela A Gallegos

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angela A Gallegos in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED AND TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 1 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 day time served. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 10/23/15.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No violent contact with her children.
-No physical discipline.
-Maintain a safe, clean home; to be periodically checked by the agent.
-Due to financial hardship Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable but waived.  DNA surcharge is waived as no DNA sample was taken.  
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment or attend school.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.  Case4 adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Angela A Gallegos in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

15RM031707  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/29/2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision with all previous conditions remaining. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Angela A Gallegos in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Angela A Gallegos in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point/WCS Case Worker Anna Kirchenwitz.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  Court amends cash bail.  Case remains calendared for Plea/ Sentencing hearing on July 16, 2015 in Branch 40.

Defendant Angela A Gallegos in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Court admonished defendant regarding her positive THC tests and advised her that any further positive tests could result in higher cash bail.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Angela A Gallegos in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Sarra Mae Kiaie for Matthew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.
*
Court admonished the defendant regarding her 2 positive drug tests and advised her that any further positive tests may result in higher cash bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CONTACT WITH M.W. (12/4/02) ONLY AS APPROVED BY THE BUREAU OF MILWAUKEE CHILD WELFARE.  IF CONTACT IS PERMITTED BY THE BMCW, THERE SHALL BE NO VIOLENT CONTACT.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Angela A Gallegos in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Angela A Gallegos in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Angela A Gallegos not in court.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5-12-2015 at 1:30pm
